text: I want to go to the optician.

I want to go to the bakery.

text: I want to go to the supermarket to buy fruit and vegetables.

text: I want to go to the baker to buy rolls and bread.

text: Do the students learn a lot?
Do you often ask the teacher questions?
No, I don’t ask him questions often.
Yes, he is working right now.
No, I don’t understand them so well.

text: Where is the football / soccer (am.) field?
My foot and hand also hurt.

text: I have a car / an automobile.

No, it costs only one hundred Euros.
Do you want some more soup?
But I already know a lot of people.
But I will be back on Sunday.
translate: Ali se vraćam već u nedjelju.
Je li tvoja kćerka već odrasla?
Ne, ona ima tek sedamnaest godina.

text: But she already has a boyfriend.
70 years ago he was still young.

text: A woman who weighs a hundred kilos is fat.

text: A man who weighs fifty kilos is thin.

For a card and a letter.

text: How long will it take to get there?

You have to dial a zero first!

Are you already allowed to drive?
Are you already allowed to drink alcohol?

text: May one pay by credit card?

text: May one pay by cheque / check (am.)?

text: May I just make a call?

text: You must wait for the taxi.
I want to make a call.
I want to send an email.
Is there a sheet of paper and a pen here?

text: Where has he left his glasses?
The clock hangs on the wall.
The children cannot find their parents.
translate: Djeca ne mogu naći njihove roditelje.

text: How was your trip, Mr. Miller?
translate: Kako je bilo Vaše putovanje, gospodine Miler?

text: Where is your wife, Mr. Miller?

text: How was your trip, Mrs. Smith?
translate: Kako je bilo Vaše putovanje, gospođo Schmidt?

text: Where is your husband, Mrs. Smith?

text: Would you like to go for a walk?
I want to relax a little.
I want to ask you something.
I want to ask you for something.
I want to treat you to something.
Or do you prefer a tea?
They want to make a call.
I am not coming because the weather is so bad.
translate: Ne dolazim jer je vrijeme tako loše.

text: He isn’t coming because he isn’t invited.
translate: On ne dolazi jer nije pozvan.

text: I am not coming because I have no time.
I am not staying because I still have to work.
translate: Ne ostajem jer moram još raditi.

text: I’m going because it is already late.
translate: Odlazim zato jer je već kasno.

text: What do you want to do?
Do you want to play football / soccer (am.)?
Do you want to visit friends?
I don’t want to arrive late.
I don’t want to go there.
I want to stay at home.
Do you want to stay here?
Do you want to eat here?
Do you want to sleep here?
Do you want to leave tomorrow?
Do you want to stay till tomorrow?
Do you want to pay the bill only tomorrow?
translate: Hoćete li račun platiti tek sutra?

text: Do you want to go to the disco?
Do you want to go to the cinema?
Do you want to go to a café?
He is staying in a hotel.
He is staying in a cheap hotel.
He is reading a boring novel.
She is watching an exciting movie.
Why aren’t you eating the cake?
I’m not eating it because I must lose weight.
translate: Ne jedem ju, jer moram smršaviti.

text: Why aren’t you drinking the beer?
I’m not drinking it because I have to drive.
translate: Ne pijem ga, jer moram još voziti.

text: Why aren’t you drinking the coffee?
I’m not drinking it because it is cold.
translate: Ne pijem je, jer je hladna.

text: Why aren’t you drinking the tea?
I’m not drinking it because I don’t have any sugar.
translate: Ne pijem ga, jer nemam šećera.

text: Why aren’t you eating the soup?
I’m not eating it because I didn’t order it.
translate: Ne jedem je, jer je nisam naručio / naručila.

text: Why don’t you eat the meat?
I’m not eating it because I am a vegetarian.
translate: Ne jedem ga, jer sam vegetarijanac.

text: Did you have to call an ambulance?
translate: Jesi li morao / morala zvati hitnu pomoć?

text: Did you have to call the doctor?
translate: Jesi li morao / morala zvati liječnika?

text: Did you have to call the police?
translate: Je si li morao / morala zvati policiju?

text: Do you have the telephone number? I had it just now.
translate: Imate li broj telefona? Upravo sam ga imao / imala.

text: Do you have the address? I had it just now.
translate: Imate li adresu? Upravo sam je imao / imala.

text: Do you have the city map? I had it just now.
translate: Imate li plan grada? Upravo sam ga imao / imala.

text: Did he come on time? He could not come on time.
translate: Je li došao točno na vrijeme? Nije mogao doći točno na vrijeme.

text: Did he find the way? He could not find the way.
translate: Je li našao put? Nije mogao naći put.

text: Did he understand you? He could not understand me.
translate: Je li te razumio? Nije me mogao razumjeti.

text: Why could you not come on time?
translate: Zašto nisi mogao / mogla doći točno na vrijeme?

text: Why could you not find the way?
translate: Zašto nisi mogao / mogla naći put?

text: Why could you not understand him?
translate: Zašto ga nisi mogao / mogla razumjeti?

text: I could not come on time because there were no buses.
translate: Nisam mogao / mogla doći točno na vrijeme jer nije vozio nijedan autobus.

text: I could not find the way because I had no city map.
translate: Nisam mogao / mogla naći put jer nisam imao plan grada.

text: I could not understand him because the music was so loud.
translate: Nisam ga mogao / mogla razumjeti jer je glazba bila preglasna.

text: I had to take a taxi.
I didn’t come because I was ill.
translate: Nisam došao / došla jer sam bio bolestan / bila bolesna.

text: I had to buy a city map.
translate: Morao / morala sam kupiti plan grada.

text: I had to switch off the radio.
She didn’t come because she was tired.
translate: Ona nije došla jer je bila umorna.

text: He didn’t come because he wasn’t interested.
translate: On nije došao jer nije imao volje.

text: We didn’t come because our car is damaged.
translate: Nismo došli jer je naš auto pokvaren.

text: They didn’t come because they missed the train.
translate: Nisu došli jer su propustili vlak.

text: I didn’t come because I was not allowed to.
translate: Nisam došao / došla jer nisam smio / smjela.

text: She took a piece of chocolate.
He was disloyal, but she was loyal.
translate: On je bio nevjeran, ali ona je bila vjerna.

text: He was lazy, but she was hard-working.
translate: On je bio lijen, ali ona je bila vrijedna.

text: He was poor, but she was rich.
translate: On je bio siromašan, ali ona je bila bogata.

text: He had no money, only debts.
translate: On nije imao novaca, nego dugove.

text: He had no luck, only bad luck.
translate: On nije imao sreće, nego peh.

text: He had no success, only failure.
translate: On nije imao uspjeh, nego neuspjeh.

text: He was not satisfied, but dissatisfied.
translate: On nije bio zadovoljan, nego nezadovoljan.

text: He was not happy, but sad.
translate: On nije bio sretan, nego nesretan.

text: He was not friendly, but unfriendly.
translate: On nije bio simpatičan, nego antipatičan.

text: I am wearing a blue dress.
I am wearing a red dress.
I am wearing a green dress.
An old lady lives at the top.
translate: Tamo gore stanuje jedna stara žena.

text: A fat lady lives at the top.
translate: Tamo gore stanuje jedna debela žena.
Tamo dolje stanuje jedna znatiželjna žena.
Naši gosti su bili dragi ljudi.
Naši gosti su bili pristojni ljudi.
Naši gosti su bili zanimljivi ljudi.

text: But the neighbours have naughty children.

translate: Odgovorio / odgovorila sam na sva pitanja.

text: I know that – I knew that.
translate: Znam to – to sam znao / znala.

text: I write that – I wrote that.
translate: Pišem to – to sam pisao / pisala.

text: I hear that – I heard that.
translate: Čujem to – to sam čuo / čula.

text: I’ll get it – I got it.
translate: Uzimam to – to sam uzeo / uzela.

text: I’ll bring that – I brought that.
translate: Donosim to – to sam donio / donijela.

text: I’ll buy that – I bought that.
translate: Kupujem to – to sam kupio / kupila.

text: I expect that – I expected that.
translate: Očekujem to – to sam očekivao / očekivala.

text: I’ll explain that – I explained that.
translate: Objašnjavam to – to sam objasnio / objasnila.

text: I know that – I knew that.
translate: Poznajem to – to sam poznavao / poznavala.

text: How did you pass the exam?
How did you find the way?
With whom did you make an appointment?
With whom did you celebrate your birthday?
What did you come to know?
Which newspaper did you subscribe to?
translate: Na koje si se novine pretplatio / pretplatila?

text: Why did you become a teacher?
Why did you take a taxi?
I was talking on the phone all the time.
I don’t know if he loves me.
translate: Ne znam da li on mene voli.

text: I don’t know if he’ll come back.
translate: Ne znam da li će se on vratiti.

text: I don’t know if he’ll call me.
translate: Ne znam da li će me nazvati.
Da li on mene ipak voli?
Da li će se on ipak vratiti?
Da li će me on ipak nazvati?

text: I wonder if he thinks about me.
translate: Pitam se da li on misli na mene.

text: I wonder if he has someone else.
translate: Pitam se da li on ima drugu.
Pitam se da li on laže.
Misli li on ipak na mene?
Ima li on ipak neku drugu?

text: Maybe he tells me the truth?
I doubt whether he really likes me.
translate: Nisam sigurna voli li on mene zaista.

text: I doubt whether he’ll write to me.
translate: Nisam sigurna hoće li mi on pisati.

text: I doubt whether he’ll marry me.
translate: Nisam sigurna ho će li me on oženiti.
Da li on mene stvarno voli?
Da li će mi ipak pisati?
Da li će me ipak oženiti?

text: We had to water the flowers.
We had to clean the apartment.
We had to wash the dishes.
Did you have to pay the bill?
Did you have to pay an entrance fee?
Did you have to pay a fine?
Who had to go home early?
translate: Tko je morao ići rano kući?

text: Who had to take the train?
We did not want to stay long.
We did not want to drink anything.
We did not want to disturb you.
I just wanted to make a call.
I just wanted to call a taxi.
Actually I wanted to drive home.
translate: Htio sam se naime odvesti kući.

text: I thought you wanted to call your wife.
translate: Mislio sam da si htio nazvati svoju suprugu.

text: I thought you wanted to call information.
translate: Mislio sam da si htio nazvati informacije.

text: I thought you wanted to order a pizza.
translate: Mislio sam da si htio naručiti pizzu.

text: I’m angry that you drink so much beer.
translate: Ljuti me što piješ tako puno piva.

text: I’m angry that you come so late.
translate: Ljuti me što dolaziš tako kasno.

text: I think he needs a doctor.
I think he is sleeping now.
We hope that he marries our daughter.
translate: Nadamo se da će on oženiti našu kćerku.

text: We hope that he has a lot of money.
translate: Nadamo se da on ima puno novaca.

text: We hope that he is a millionaire.
translate: Nadamo se da je on milijunaš.

text: I heard that your wife had an accident.
translate: Čuo / čula sam da je tvoja žena imala nesreću.

text: I heard that she is in the hospital.
translate: Čuo / čula sam da ona leži u bolnici.

text: I heard that your car is completely wrecked.
translate: Čuo / čula sam da je tvoj auto totalno pokvaren.

text: I’m happy that you are interested.
I’m happy that you want to buy the house.
translate: Raduje me da želite kupiti kuću.

text: I’m afraid the last bus has already gone.
translate: Bojim se da je zadnji autobus već otišao.

text: I’m afraid we will have to take a taxi.
translate: Bojim se da moramo uzeti taksi.

text: I’m afraid I have no more money.
translate: Bojim se da nemam novaca kod sebe.

text: My son did not want to play with the doll.
translate: Moj se sin nije htio igrati s lutkom.

text: My daughter did not want to play football / soccer (am.).
translate: Moja kćerka nije htjela igrati nogomet.

text: My wife did not want to play chess with me.
translate: Moja supruga nije htjela sa mnom igrati šah.

text: My children did not want to go for a walk.
translate: Moja se djeca nisu htjela šetati.

text: They did not want to tidy the room.
They did not want to go to bed.
translate: Oni nisu htjeli ići u krevet.

text: He was not allowed to eat ice cream.
He was not allowed to eat chocolate.
He was not allowed to eat sweets.
I was allowed to make a wish.
I was allowed to buy myself a dress.
I was allowed to take a chocolate.
translate: Smio / smjela sam uzeti jednu pralinu.

text: Were you allowed to smoke in the airplane?
translate: Jesi li smio / smjela pušiti u zrakoplovu?

text: Were you allowed to drink beer in the hospital?
translate: Jesi li smio / smjela piti pivo u bolnici?

text: Were you allowed to take the dog into the hotel?
translate: Jesi li smio / smjela povesti psa u hotel?

text: During the holidays the children were allowed to remain outside late.
translate: Djeca su za vrijeme praznika smjela dugo ostati vani.

text: They were allowed to play in the yard for a long time.
translate: Smjela su se dugo igrati u dvorištu.

text: They were allowed to stay up late.
I get up as soon as the alarm rings.
I become tired as soon as I have to study.
I will stop working as soon as I am 60.
As soon as I have a moment.
translate: Čim budem imao / imala trenutak slobodnog vremena.

text: He’ll call, as soon as he has a little time.
translate: Nazvat će čim bude imao nešto vremena.

text: I’ll work as long as I can.
translate: Radit ću dok budem mogao / mogla.

text: I’ll work as long as I am healthy.
translate: Radit ću dok budem zdrav / zdrava.

text: He lies in bed instead of working.
translate: On leži u krevetu umjesto da radi.

text: She reads the newspaper instead of cooking.
translate: Ona čita novine umjesto da kuha.

text: He is at the bar instead of going home.
translate: On sjedi u krčmi umjesto da ide kući.

text: As far as I know, he lives here.
translate: Koliko ja znam, on stanuje ovdje.

text: As far as I know, his wife is ill.
translate: Koliko ja znam, njegova žena je bolesna.

text: As far as I know, he is unemployed.
translate: Koliko ja znam, on je nezaposlen.

text: Perhaps the weather will get better tomorrow.
translate: Vrijeme će sutra možda biti bolje.

text: I hope that it gets better.
translate: Nadam se da će biti bolje.

text: I overslept; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Prespavao sam, inače bih bio točan.

text: I missed the bus; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Propustio sam autobus, inače bih bio točan.

text: I didn’t find the way / I got lost; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Nisam našao put, inače bih bio točan.

text: Do you know that for sure?
I think that it is old.
He fell asleep although the TV was on.
translate: Iako je televizor bio uključen, on je zaspao.

text: He stayed a while although it was late.
translate: Iako je već bilo kasno, on je još ostao.
Smatram da on čak vrlo dobro izgleda.

text: The boss definitely has a girlfriend.
It is very possible that he has a girlfriend.
translate: Sasvim je moguće da on ima djevojku.

text: He didn’t come although we had made an appointment.
translate: Iako smo se dogovorili, on nije došao.

text: The TV was on. Nevertheless, he fell asleep.
translate: Televizor je bio uključen. Usprkos tome on je zaspao.

text: It was already late. Nevertheless, he stayed a while.
translate: Bilo je kasno. Usprkos tome on je još ostao.

text: We had made an appointment. Nevertheless, he didn’t come.
translate: Dogovorili smo se. Usprkos tome on nije došao.

text: Although he has no license, he drives the car.
translate: Iako nema vozačku dozvolu, on vozi auto.

text: Although the road is slippery, he drives so fast.
translate: Iako je cesta skliska, on vozi brzo.

text: Although he is drunk, he rides his bicycle.
translate: Iako je pijan, on vozi bicikl.

text: Despite having no licence / license (am.), he drives the car.
translate: On nema vozačku dozvolu. Usprkos tome on vozi auto.

text: Despite the road being slippery, he drives fast.
translate: Cesta je skliska. Usprkos tome on vozi tako brzo.

text: Despite being drunk, he rides the bike.
translate: On je pijan. Usprkos tome on vozi bicikl.

text: Although she went to college, she can’t find a job.
translate: Iako je studirala, ona ne nalazi radno mjesto.

text: Although she is in pain, she doesn’t go to the doctor.
translate: Iako ima bolove, ona ne ide kod liječnika.

text: You are so lazy – don’t be so lazy!
translate: Ti si tako lijen / lijena – ne budi tako lijen / lijena!

text: You sleep for so long – don’t sleep so late!
translate: Spavaš tako dugo – ne spavaj tako dugo!

text: You come home so late – don’t come home so late!
translate: Dolaziš tako kasno – ne dolazi tako kasno!

text: The journey was beautiful, but too tiring.
translate: Putovanje je bilo lijepo, ali previše naporno.

text: The train was on time, but too full.
translate: Vlak je bio točan, ali prepun.

text: Although she has no money, she buys a car.
translate: Iako nema novaca, ona kupuje auto.

text: She went to college. Nevertheless, she can’t find a job.
translate: Ona je studirala. Usprkos tome ona ne nalazi nikakvo radno mjesto.

text: She is in pain. Nevertheless, she doesn’t go to the doctor.
translate: Ona ima bolove. Usprkos tome ona ne ide kod liječnika.

text: She has no money. Nevertheless, she buys a car.
translate: Ona nema novaca. Usprkos tome ona kupuje auto.

text: You laugh so loudly – don’t laugh so loudly!
translate: Smiješ se tako glasno – ne smij se tako glasno!

text: You speak so softly – don’t speak so softly!
translate: Govoriš tako tiho – ne govori tako tiho!

text: You drink too much – don’t drink so much!
translate: Piješ previše – ne pij tako puno!

text: You smoke too much – don’t smoke so much!
translate: Pušiš previše – ne puši tako puno!

text: You work too much – don’t work so much!
translate: Radiš previše – ne radi tako puno!

text: You drive too fast – don’t drive so fast!
translate: Voziš tako brzo – ne vozi tako brzo!

text: The hotel was comfortable, but too expensive.
translate: Hotel je bio ugodan, ali preskup.

text: He’ll take either the bus or the train.
translate: On ide ili autobusom ili vlakom.

text: He’ll come either this evening or tomorrow morning.
translate: On dolazi ili večeras ili sutra rano ujutro.

text: He’s going to stay either with us or in the hotel.
translate: On stanuje ili kod nas ili u hotelu.

text: She speaks Spanish as well as English.
translate: Ona govori i španjolski i engleski.

text: She has lived in Madrid as well as in London.
translate: Ona je živjela i u Madridu i u Londonu.

text: She knows Spain as well as England.
translate: Ona poznaje i Španjolsku i Englesku.

text: He is not only stupid, but also lazy.
translate: On nije samo glup, nego i lijen.

text: She is not only pretty, but also intelligent.
translate: Ona nije samo lijepa, nego i inteligentna.

text: She speaks not only German, but also French.
translate: Ona ne govori samo njemački, nego i francuski.

text: I can neither play the piano nor the guitar.
translate: Ja ne znam svirati ni klavir ni gitaru.

text: I can neither waltz nor do the samba.
translate: Ja ne znam plesati ni valcer ni sambu.

text: I like neither opera nor ballet.
translate: Ja ne volim ni operu ni balet.

text: The faster you work, the earlier you will be finished.
translate: Što brže radiš, to si ranije gotov.

text: The earlier you come, the earlier you can go.
translate: Što ranije dođeš, to ranije možeš otići.

text: The older one gets, the more complacent one gets.
translate: Što je čovjek stariji, to više komotniji.

text: Since when is she no longer working?
translate: Od kada ona više ne radi?

text: Yes, she is no longer working since she got married.
translate: Da, ona više ne radi od kada se udala.

text: Since she got married, she’s no longer working.
translate: Od kada se udala, više ne radi.

text: Since they have met each other, they are happy.
translate: Od kada se poznaju, sretni su.

text: Since they have had children, they rarely go out.
translate: Od kada imaju djecu, izlaze rjeđe.

text: She watches TV while she irons.
She listens to music while she does her work.
translate: Ona sluša glazbu dok rješava zadatke.

text: I can’t see anything when I don’t have glasses.
translate: Ja ne vidim ništa kad ne nosim naočale.

text: I can’t understand anything when the music is so loud.
translate: Ne razumijem ništa kad je glazba tako glasna.

text: I can’t smell anything when I have a cold.
translate: Ne osjećam mirise kad sam prehlađen.

text: We’ll take a taxi if it rains.
translate: Mi uzimamo taksi, аkо kiša pada.

text: We’ll travel around the world if we win the lottery.
translate: Ako dobijemo na lotu, ići ćemo na putovanje оko svijeta.

text: We’ll start eating if he doesn’t come soon.
translate: Ako on uskoro ne dođe, počet ćemo s jelom.
Čekaj dok se on ne vrati.

text: I’ll wait until my hair is dry.
translate: Čekam dok mi se kosa ne osuši.

text: I’ll wait until the film is over.
I’ll wait until the traffic light is green.
translate: Čekam dok ne bude zeleno svjetlo na semaforu.

text: When do you go on holiday?
Yes, before the summer holidays begin.
translate: Da, još prije nego što počnu ljetni praznici.

text: Repair the roof before the winter begins.
translate: Popravi krov prije nego što dođe zima.

text: Wash your hands before you sit at the table.
translate: Operi ruke prije nego što sjedneš za stol.

text: Close the window before you go out.
translate: Zatvori prozor prije nego što izađeš.

text: Yes, after the class is over.
After he had an accident, he could not work anymore.
translate: Nakon što je imao nesreću, nije više mogao raditi.

text: After he had lost his job, he went to America.
translate: Nakon što je izgubio posao, otišao je u Ameriku.

text: After he went to America, he became rich.
translate: Nakon što je otišao u Ameriku, postao je bogat.

text: Have you already been to Berlin?
translate: Jeste li već jednom bili u Berlinu?

text: No, I don’t know anyone here.
a little longer – not much longer
Will you stay here a little longer?
No, I won’t stay here much longer.
translate: Ne, ne ostajem više dugo ovdje.

text: Would you like to drink something else?
No, I don’t want anything else.
No, I haven’t eaten anything yet.
translate: Ne, još ništa nisam jeo / jela.

text: Does anyone else want a coffee?
The button from the shirt is gone.
The boss’ computer is not working.
How do I get to her parents’ house?
translate: Kako da dođem do kuće njenih roditelja?

text: The house is at the end of the road.
What is the name of the capital city of Switzerland?
translate: Kako se zove glavni grad Švicarske?

text: What is the title of the book?
What are the names of the neighbour’s / neighbor’s (am.) children?
What are the doctor’s consultation times?
translate: Kada su liječnikovi termini za pacijente?

text: What time is the museum open?
